sage.camera.controllers

Interface ICameraController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCameraController, FPCameraController, ThirdPersonChaseCameraController, ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController

    public interface ICameraController
    The ICameraController interface exposes the public methods that all camera controllers must implement.
    Author:
    Kenneth Barnett

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disable()
      Disables the camera controller.
      void enable()
      Enables the camera controller.
      ICamera getCamera()
      Returns the ICamera attached to the camera controller.
      boolean getIsEnabled()
      Returns true if the camera controller is enabled; false if it is disabled.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the camera controller.
      SceneNode getTarget()
      Returns the camera controller's target.
      graphicslib3D.Vector3D getWorldUpVector()
      Returns a clone of the camera controller's Vector3D world "up" vector.
      void setCamera(ICamera camera)
      Attaches a ICamera to the camera controller.
      void setCursorImage(int type)
      Sets the camera controllers mouse cursor to a pre-defined cursor type.
      void setCursorImage(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String cursorName, java.awt.Point hotspot)
      Sets the camera controllers mouse cursor to a user defined cursor.
      void setInputMode(IInputManager inputMgr, java.lang.String controllerName)
      Sets which input controller the camera controller will use to manipulate the camera.
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of the camera controller.
      void setTarget(SceneNode target)
      Sets the camera controller's target;
      void setWorldUpVector(graphicslib3D.Vector3D worldUp)
      Sets the vector that the camera controller will use as the world "up" vector.
      void toggleMouseCursorVisibility()
      Toggles the mouse cursor ON/OFF.
      void update(float time)
      Updates the internal logic of the camera controller.

    • Method Detail

      • getIsEnabled

        boolean getIsEnabled()
        Returns true if the camera controller is enabled; false if it is disabled.

        Enabled means that the camera controller controls the positioning and orientation (via user input) of the camera.

        Disabled means that the camera controller no longer controls the positioning and orientation (via user input) of the camera.

      • enable

        void enable()
        Enables the camera controller. This means that the controller now affects the positioning of the camera and input affects the orientation of the camera.

      • disable

        void disable()
        Disables the camera controller. This means that the controller no longer affects the positioning of the camera and input no longer affects the orientation of the camera.

      • getTarget

        SceneNode getTarget()
        Returns the camera controller's target.

      • setTarget

        void setTarget(SceneNode target)
        Sets the camera controller's target;

      • getCamera

        ICamera getCamera()
        Returns the ICamera attached to the camera controller.

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(ICamera camera)
        Attaches a ICamera to the camera controller.

      • getWorldUpVector

        graphicslib3D.Vector3D getWorldUpVector()
        Returns a clone of the camera controller's Vector3D world "up" vector.

      • setWorldUpVector

        void setWorldUpVector(graphicslib3D.Vector3D worldUp)
        Sets the vector that the camera controller will use as the world "up" vector. The camera controller's default world up vector is (0, 1, 0).

      • setCursorImage

        void setCursorImage(int type)
        Sets the camera controllers mouse cursor to a pre-defined cursor type.
        Parameters:
        type - - The java pre-defined cursor value. Use Cursor static values to choose a type. e.g. Cursor.DEFAULT_CURSOR

      • setCursorImage

        void setCursorImage(java.lang.String imageName,
                    java.lang.String cursorName,
                    java.awt.Point hotspot)
        Sets the camera controllers mouse cursor to a user defined cursor.
        Parameters:
        imageName - - The file name (full path & file extension) of the cursor image.
        cursorName - - The name of the cursor.
        hotspot - - The cursor "hotspot". It is where the O.S. detects the "mouse click".

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the camera controller.

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the camera controller.

      • toggleMouseCursorVisibility

        void toggleMouseCursorVisibility()
        Toggles the mouse cursor ON/OFF. This is NOT the crosshair of the camera controller.

      • setInputMode

        void setInputMode(IInputManager inputMgr,
                  java.lang.String controllerName)
        Sets which input controller the camera controller will use to manipulate the camera.
        Parameters:
        inputMgr - - The IInputManager which provides access to controllers
        controllerName - - the name of the controller containing the components which manipulate the first-person camera

      • update

        void update(float time)
        Updates the internal logic of the camera controller.
        Parameters:
        time - - Elapsed time in milliseconds.
